content: I hope you guys are hungry soups ready hey guys welcome back to another episode
of black magic crafts do you need a place to dissolve some body parts well
I'm going to show you a way you can make the disgusting
bloody dissolving meat pit for your game table using only materials from the
dollar store and all really easy techniques and even if you don't want to
build these specifically there's a few materials and techniques that you could
implement and all sorts of other builds so let's take a look at how I made them
you'll need something to use as the cauldron or pot I wanted something that
looks a little different so I use these plastic hair curlers if you're looking
for them at the dollar store keep in mind they usually have a layer of velcro
on them that you have to peel off first I cut mine down into two rows high and
they ended up looking something like this you might need to clean up the
rough edges with an exacto knife for the bottom of the cauldron grab some thin
cardboard or cardstock and trace out the inner circle of the air curler and cut
it to size next fit the cardboard into the hair curler you should try to get it
to be a tight fit so that it stays in place just from the pressure to fill the
gap on the sides of the cauldron I cut some narrow strips of cardstock and
glued them around the inside edge with superglue
to keep everything in place and stop any leaks when doing the resin I ran a line
of hot glue around the inside edge add a bit of decoration and make the cauldron
look a little more sinister I cut the prongs off of a plastic fork
and super glued one to each side to make the bond better I gave all the plastic a
lights and with a nail file while the glue was setting up I prepared some
bones for the pit to mimic skulls I use the same styrofoam beads I used for
spider eggs in episode 7 for bones I cut little pieces of toothpick and for rib
cages I use the legs from some of these cheap little plastic spiders I put all
the stuff together in a cup and added a few drops of ivory paint I stirred it
all together to give it all a similar bone color to avoid having it all stick
together I spread the bits out on a piece of paper to dry paint the cauldron
first free paint the whole thing with a flat black it's a matter of taste as to
what type of metal to paint these as but I felt it would add some nice
juxtaposition to the piece to make them sort of an ornate gold and brass instead
of just an iron so I use the metallic brass paint for the first coat to make
the piece look even more ornate I did the second coat with a really bright
golden bronze and last I did highlights with a pure gold
and now for the fun part the bloody liquid to achieve this I use
a 5-minute clear epoxy that you can buy from the dollar store I like it for
stuff like this because you can mix it with basically anything and it won't
cause any issues during curing it also cures incredibly fast the resin is dried
to the touch in under 10 minutes so you don't have to wait around for days for
it to cure after mixing up the two parts of resin I mix in a very small amount of
red paint I used a darker and a lighter red to get the color I wanted then I
took the rib cage as I had prepared and placed them into the cauldron I took the
other bits of bone and mixed them right into the resin and then pour the resin
mix right into the cauldron and move it around to make sure it covers the whole
base I took some time to get the pieces positioned in a way that I liked and
once I was happy with it I set it on a level surface for 10 minutes to cure
once the resin had cured I did one last
finishing touch by giving the metal a brown wash this gave it a suitable level
of grime considering its intended purpose and that's it all done alright
guys I hope you found this video useful if you did hit that like button and drop
me a comment below and if you build something inspired by one of my videos
go over to the black magic craft Facebook page and post a picture if you
haven't already subscribed hit that button and last if you really want to
help this channel grow the best way you can do that is by supporting black magic
crafts on patreon all the funding goes directly towards new video equipment and
software so that I can bring you better content and give it to you more often
I'll see you again next time peace
